passages.title: Learning lessons from the past
passages.body: A. Many past societies collapsed or vanished, leaving behind monumental ruins... [full passage content]
passages.section_instruction: You should spend about 20 minutes on Questions 27-40 which are based on Reading Passage 3 below.

questions.question_text: When the writer describes the impact of monumental ruins today, he emphasises
questions.instruction: Choose the correct letter: A, B, C or D
options: A. the income they generate from tourism.
B. the area of land they occupy.

questions.question_text: Recent findings concerning vanished civilisations
questions.instruction: Choose the correct letter: A, B, C or D
options: C. come from a variety of disciplines.
D. identified one main cause of environmental damage.

questions.question_text: What does the writer say about ways in which former societies collapsed?
questions.instruction: Choose the correct letter: A, B, C or D
options: A. The pace of decline was usually similar.
B. The likelihood of collapse would have been foreseeable.
C. Deterioration invariably led to total collapse.
D. Individual citizens could sometimes influence the course of events.

questions.question_text: It is widely believed that environmental problems represent the main danger faced by the modern world.
questions.instruction: Do the following statements agree with the views of the writer in Reading Passage?

questions.question_text: The accumulation of poisonous substances is a relatively modern problem.
questions.instruction: Do the following statements agree with the views of the writer in Reading Passage?

questions.question_text: There is general agreement that the threats posed by environmental problems are very serious.
questions.instruction: Do the following statements agree with the views of the writer in Reading Passage?

questions.question_text: Some past societies resembled present-day societies more closely than others.
questions.instruction: Do the following statements agree with the views of the writer in Reading Passage?

questions.question_text: We should be careful when drawing comparisons between past and present.
questions.instruction: Do the following statements agree with the views of the writer in Reading Passage?

questions.question_text: Evidence of the greatness of some former civilisations
questions.instruction: Complete each sentence with the correct ending
options: B. provides grounds for an optimistic outlook.
C. exists in the form of physical structures.
D. is potentially both positive and negative.
E. will not provide direct solution for present problems.
F. is greater now than in the past

questions.question_text: What is the main argument of Reading Passage 3?
questions.instruction: Choose the correct letter, A, B, C or D
options: A. There are differences as well as similarities between past and present societies.
B. More should be done to preserve the physical remains of earlier civilisations.
C. Some historical accounts of great civilisations are inaccurate.
D. Modern societies are dependent on each other for their continuing survival.
